COMMENT_TX: $First NL game at RFK Stadium; first game in DC since 1971. Debut game for Retrosheet Secretary David Vincent as major league official scorer.
$infield shifted towards right for Delgado
25 correct at 2B because of shift
$infield shifted towards right for Delgado
25 correct at 2B because of shift
$first run scored on Willis in 2005; 24 innings
Nationals pitcher T. J. Tucker left the game due to an injured groin
Nationals third baseman Vinny Castilla left the game due to an injured shin
fan interference
Debut game for Royce Ring
Protest=V
$both sides warned after inside pitch to Floyd
30 minute rain delay
ej,robif103,M,hallt901,Protesting field conditions Nationals Manager Frank Robinson ejected by HP umpire Tom Hallion
37 minute rain delay; it took 31 minutes for the grounds crew to cover the infield with the tarp; the Mets later protested the game
$Game called for rain
$Eischen leaped for Matsui's ball and fell hard on his arm; he broke his right radius bone; surgery and out 8-12 weeks
Cubs pitcher Carlos Zambrano left game due to an injured arm
Nationals pitcher Livan Hernandez left game due to an injured knee
ej,robif103,M,hirsj901,Balls and strikes Nationals Manager Frank Robinson ejected by HP umpire John Hirschbeck
$sixth consecutive win for Hernandez
originally ruled E4 but changed after the game

Jordan hit a fly down the LF line that was ruled a home run; Robinson talked with 3B umpire Layne and then the umpires conferred and the ball was declared foul; the pole appears to be misaligned with the line
Nationals Nick Johnson left game with chest pains caused by stomach reflux
Wilkerson's throw hit Betemit at 3B
Bennett's 5 RBI ties a career high
$Ohka had his back turned when Robinson came out to remove him;  Robinson snatched ball out of his hand and argument continued in dugout; Ohka fined $1000 the next day by the club

ej,byrdm001,P,millb901,Checked swing $Byrd out on half-swing appeal; he was halfway to 1B when call came from 1B umpire Miller; Byrd restrained by 1B coach Buford; as he went to LF, Byrd continued to argue and was ejected by Miller; he charged at the umpire and 2B umpire Brinkman ran over to intervene; when he realized he could not get in front of Byrd, Brinkman stuck out his arm; Byrd ran right through the arm and Brinkman was spun around and landed on his back; after attention from both trainers, Brinkman remained in game with cut on forehead and some bruises; on June 9, Byrd suspended for two games
$Harris' 200th career pinch hit
Debut game for Rick Short
Mariners 3B Adrian Beltre left the game due to a tight left hamstring
$President Bush attended game
2:08 rain delay with 2-2 count on Mackowiak
home run on first pitch after rain delay
Debut game for Nate McLouth
ej,mccll001,M,guccc901,Balls and strikes Pirates Manager Lloyd McClendon ejected by HP umpire Chris Guccione; there were a lot of comments about the strike zone and checked swing calls
Mets SS Chris Woodward left the game due to an injured knee
Throw home from Byrd hit runner and bounced to pitcher who threw behind batter who had rounded first too far.  Apparently he did not see that the previous runner had stopped at second
ej,vidrj001,P,wegnm901,Called third strike (slammed helmet) Nationals second baseman Jose Vidro ejected by HP umpire Mark Wegner for slamming helmet to the ground
$Byrnes over threw the cutoff and Vidro took off as the ball rolled past him; Gonzalez retrieved the ball and tagged Vidro
$Stanton's 1000th major league game; 10th pitcher with 1000
ej,garnp001,M,fullt901,Call at 1B Astros Manager Phil Garner ejected by 1B umpire Troy Fullwood
Jose Guillen hit on wrist; X-rays negative
Nationals out of position players
pitcher as pinch hitter
pitcher as pinch hitter
Dodgers Jason Phillips left the game due to an injured hand/wrist
Nationals pitcher Tony Armas left the game due to an injured neck/shoulder
Nationals pitcher Tony Armas left the game due to a sore right shoulder
off the facing of the upper deck in center field well over the 410 marker
Griffey's 40th park to homer in
balk called because 1Bman Casey moved away from the bag into the dirt cutout; he was fooled by Shackelford's motion and caught the ball nearly on the grass

ej,pujoa001,P,poncl901,Continuing to argue caught stealing Cardinals first baseman Albert Pujols ejected by 1B umpire Larry Poncino; he was not happy with the call on the caught stealing and continued to talk about it after returning to the field on defense
Edmonds left after banging his knee on Bennett's shin guard
Debut game for Jason Bergmann
David Bell's first career grand slam
Zimmerman's first career hit; he was drafted out of college in June
Johnson left with contusion of the right heel; he is listed as day-to-day
the ball landed in the upper deck in section 447
Debut game for Darrell Rasner
Short's first home run
Debut game for Josh Wilson
Beckett's first career home run
LaRoche was hit on the side of the head by Johnson's line drive
about 6 rows into upper deck; #706 of career
4th consecutive game with HR for Bonds; #707
Schneider left with sore shoulder
$Durham ran out and caught the ball but dropped it; ruled no catch by Fairchild; brief argument by the Giants
Rick Short left the game due to a partially dislocated left shoulder
